memberdef.name: SmallMatrix

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: The data are uninitialized by default. If you want to initialize to zero, you can do SmallMatrix<T,NRows,NCols> M{};.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE AMREX_FORCE_INLINE constexpr amrex::SmallMatrix< T, NRows, NCols, ORDER, StartIndex >::SmallMatrix
memberdef.name: SmallMatrix

briefdescription.para: Constructs column- or row-vector.

detaileddescription.para: The data are initialized with the given variadic arguments. If the number of argument is less than the size of the vector, the rest of the vector is initialized to zero.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE AMREX_FORCE_INLINE amrex::SmallMatrix< T, NRows, NCols, ORDER, StartIndex >::SmallMatrix
memberdef.name: SmallMatrix

briefdescription.para: Constructs SmallMatrix with nested std::initializer_list.

detaileddescription.para: The initializer list is assumed to be in row-major order, even when the ordering for the SmallMatrix object is colum-major. Below is an example of constructing a matrix with 2 rows and 3 columns. SmallMatrix<double,2,3> M{{11., 12., 13.}, {21., 22., 23.}};

SmallMatrix< U, N2, N3, Ord, SI > const &

briefdescription.para: Returns matrix product of two matrices.
Matrix class with compile-time size.

detaileddescription.para: Note that column vectors and row vectors are special cases of a Matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Memory layout order. Order::F (i.e., column-major) by default.

node.label: amrex::SmallMatrix< T, NRows, NCols, ORDER, StartIndex >
